definitions.definition: decrease in size, number, or range.
synonyms: decline "the market for such goods began to contract"

definitions.definition: (of a muscle) become shorter or tighter in order to effect movement of part of the body.
examples: the heart is a muscle that contracts about seventy times a minute

definitions.definition: shorten (a word or phrase) by combination or elision.
synonyms: reduce; elide "his name was soon contracted to “Rob”"

definitions.definition: enter into a formal and legally binding agreement.
examples: the local authority will contract with a wide range of agencies to provide services
synonyms: make a deal "the company contracted to rebuild the stadium"

definitions.definition: secure specified rights or undertake specified obligations in a formal and legally binding agreement.
examples: a buyer may contract for the right to withhold payment

definitions.definition: impose an obligation on (someone) to do something by means of a formal agreement.
examples: health authorities contract a hospital to treat a specific number of patients

definitions.definition: arrange for work to be done by another organization.
examples: local authorities will have to contract out waste management
synonyms: farm out "trash collection is contracted out by the town"

examples: before Fanny met him, he had contracted a disastrous liaison and marriage

definitions.definition: enter into (a friendship or other relationship).
examples: the patterns of social relationships contracted by men and women differ

definitions.definition: catch or develop (a disease or infectious agent).
examples: three people contracted a killer virus

synonyms: run up "he contracted a debt of $3
